Job Title: Senior Analyst - Investments and Business Perf
Description: Job Description Publication date: 12.09.2018  REFERENCE: 5101885301  Company   Company: Avangrid Renewables   Job Title: Senior Analyst   Department: Structuring   Location: Portland, OR   Business and Department   Portland Corporate Office   Portland,OR   Description   The Lead/Senior Investment and Business Performance Analyst is responsible for performing internal   cross-functional analysis and market & competitor follow up within the Investment and Business Performance   group.   The Investment and Business Performance group is primarily accountable for evaluating all renewable origination   and development transactions. As well as performing global internal analysis and tracking market and competitor   trends. It serves as both a challenger and partner to the business with respect to transaction analysis, pipeline   evaluation, and global analysis. The team, which also has international relationships, heavily interacts with other   local departments such as Control, Finance, Risk Management and Fundamentals.   The analyst will work closely with the rest of the group to identify key areas of cross-analysis and provide tools that   help obtain a better understanding of the general environment. The position also will have a strong relationship with   the Global Iberdrola Investment office. He/she will also interact with stakeholders from other business units.   This position will report to the Global Analysis manager within the Investment and Business Performance group.   Key Responsibilities  Develop global projects and analysis within the Investment & Business Performance team. Consolidate project specific information enabling the comparison analysis from a global perspective. Homogenize analysis and evaluation criteria for the different geographical areas and technologies, managing  the consistency and coherence of information.  Analyze the renewable operating portfolio value, profitability, projections and income statement contribution. Analyze the renewable pipeline to assess its viability and alignment with the company strategy and  projections.  Perform the analysis and monitoring of the renewable sector. Regulation, technology, trends, financial  products, M&A activity, etc.  Follow up and analyze the main competitors within the renewable sector. Strategic and financial analysis. Prepare documentation required by the management team for decision making. Carry out data consolidation and coordination tasks within the Investment & Business Performance team. Requirements A bachelor's degree in economics, finance, or related field is required or equivalent combination of education  and experience.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in the utility/energy industry Demonstrated business and financial analysis skills. Experience in the development and use of financial  models is a plus.  Ability to interact with all levels of the business. Strong analytical skills with the ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines. Strong presentation skills, combined with written and verbal communication skills are a must. Microsoft Office advance user (Excel, Power Point, Word) Ability to manage large amounts of data. Experience using Tableau or similar programs is a plus. English language proficiency, both written and verbal. Fluent in Spanish is a plus.  All offers of employment are contingent upon the successful completion of a medical Fit for Duty exam (only if   applicable to job requirements), background check, references, drug screen, verification of legal right to work in the   U.S., and in some cases, a credit check. A credit check will be administered when a prospective employee will be   working in Finance, Accounting, Treasury or where duties may involve handling of funds, accounts or cash. A Motor   Vehicle (MVR) check will be administered when a prospective employee will be regularly using a company vehicle.   Avangrid Renewables is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for   employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as an   individual with a disability, or any other status or class protected by federal or state law. Overview Programmer Analyst I, II, or Senior Portland, OR Bring your experience to a role where you will: Perform technical, analytical, support, and leadership functions to help the division and the company meet its goals. Responsible for programming business solutions based on requirements for all business areas within Cambia Health Solutions.  Responsibilities & Requirements This is a multi-level position depending on experience. Keen analytical and problem-solving skills. Solid oral and written communication skills, including presentation and technical writing skills. Familiarity with relational databases and client-server concepts. Demonstrated computer skills using ETL, SQL coding and report tools. Must be able to develop efficient and effective program and system solutions in solving business problems. Ability to review, analyze, and enhance configuration/programming systems including coding, testing, and debugging. Ability to consult with application’s users to identify current operating procedures and to clarify program objectives. Must be able to effectively adapt to changing technologies and methodologies and apply them to technological and/or business needs. Understanding of business process improvement, benefit and risk management, software testing, and of all testing events throughout the development lifecycle. A wide degree of creativity is required. Knowledge of healthcare and healthcare business processes a plus. Demonstrated proficiency in code development using multiple tools  SQL: (Toad, PGAdmin, etc.)   ETL: (Talend, etc.)   Scripting: (Python, Powershell, etc.)   Databases: (Greenplum, PostgreSQL, MS SQL, AWS, Oracle)   Reporting: (Tableau, SSRS, etc.)   Light Web Apps: (API’s/Javascript/Node/React/Redux/Postman)  Additional Minimum Requirements for level II Demonstrated success with project management. Ability to work independently on complex projects and issues with large financial and/or risk impact to the corporation. Additional Minimum Requirements for Senior level Highly advanced analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrate success with project management, including handling multiple, concurrent projects. Ability to represent the division visibly in internal meetings as a leadership presence. Expert proficiency in code development using multiple tools as level II plus. Architecture:(Methodologies, Visio, Documentation). Demonstrated expert skill level in solutions architecture and design. Normally to be proficient in the competencies listed above:  The  Programmer Analyst I  would have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Operational Technology Management, Computer Science, Operations Research or an equivalent related field and 5+ years job-related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and related work experience.   The  Programmer Analyst II  would have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Operational Technology Management, Computer Science, Operations Research or an equivalent related field and 7+ years job-related work experience including 2+ years prior work experience in healthcare and healthcare business processes. or an equivalent combination of education and related work experience.   The  Programmer Analyst Senior  would have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Operational Technology Management, Computer Science, Operations Research or an equivalent related field and 10+ years job-related work experience including 4+ years prior work experience in healthcare and healthcare business processes or an equivalent combination of education and related work experience.  General Functions and Outcomes: Design, develop or direct the development of, and direct the performance of acceptance testing of new reports, programs, and models. Proactively identify issues and concerns to management. Apply knowledge of how various departments within the corporation work together to make the company run effectively. Communicate effectively with both internal and external clients. Write documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, and changes. Interpret business requirements and develop design specifications. Write code or configuration to implement business requirements using approved technologies. Develop tests to validate correct implementation of the business requirements. Acquire knowledgof Cambia data systems to meet the analytical and reporting needs of the division and the corporation. Actively participate in the division’s peer review processes. Responsible for corporate profitability by prudent management of risk. Additional General Functions & Outcomes for level II (Pay Level 19 Assist and mentor other team members and internal business partners. Keep familiar with the latest developments in medical management programs, cost containment strategies, medical technology, market conditions as they relate to healthcare and revisions to existing coding structures. Additional General Functions & Outcomes for Senior Level Oversee and direct projects and assist in the training of staff as it relates to these projects. Contribute to strategic and tactical planning efforts. Apply knowledge of how various departments within the corporation work together to make the company run effectively.  About Us At Cambia, we advocate for transforming the health care system. You aren’t satisfied with the status quo and neither are we. We're looking for individuals who are as passionate as we are about transforming the way people experience health care. We offer a competitive salary and a generous benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug and tobacco-free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by law. A drug screen and background check is required.   Cambia’s portfolio of companies spans health care information technology and software development; retail health care; health insurance plans that carry the Blue Cross and Blue Shield brands; pharmacy benefit management; life, disability, dental, vision and other lines of protection; alternative solutions to health care access; and free-standing health and wellness solutions.   We have nearly a century of experience in developing and providing health solutions to serve our members. We had our beginnings in the logging communities of the Pacific Northwest as innovators in helping workers afford health care. That pioneering spirit has kept us at the forefront as we build new avenues to improve access to and quality of health care for the future.

Description:  ProvidenceSt. Joseph Health is calling a Senior Talent Acquisition Systems Analyst ineither of the following locations: Renton/  Seattle/Spokane WA, Burbank/Irvine/Torrance CA or Beaverton/PortlandOR.  We are seeking an experienced analyst to focus on current and future talent acquisition   (TA) systems that enable our caregivers across multiple brands to attract and   hire the most qualified talent.   This position provides business analysis, technical consultation and support to TA   for their system and technology needs across Providence St. Joseph and its   affiliates. The Sr. Analyst maintains expert status in the recruitment   systems and procedures.   The Sr. Analyst is a highly collaborative, analytical and systems savvy individual   who provides consultative expertise and oversight of recruiting systems and   processes. This role will focus on Customer   Relationship Management (CRM) and Marketing Automation (MA) systems enhancements, optimizations,   upgrades, as well as, implementation of new technologies and integration with other   existing systems. Furthermore, this role acts as a liaison for the TA Integrated   Systems team with TA teams and business partners, enterprise applications, HR   Information Systems (HRIS), onboarding, and external TA vendors.   The   scope of work includes, but is not limited to: development, implementation,   management, training and monitoring of TA information systems. Actively   participates in creating audit plans, schedules and testing of system upgrades   and new configurations. This position identifies, designs and conducts   quantitative and qualitative analysis of system wide talent acquisition and   human resources related data.   Project Management  Partner with TA Integrated Systems Manager to deliver complex cross-functional projects   in order to meet and exceed scope, cost and schedule; acts as a subject matter   expert (SME) for all TA systems/modules, actively participates in optimization   by driving the definition and organization of business requirements and other   user requests; proactively eliminates bottlenecks and balances the business   needs versus technical constraints; identifies, assesses, tracks and helps   mitigate or avoid issues and risks at multiple levels; creates, maintains and   disseminates project information to stakeholders.   Systems  Partner with TA Integrated Systems Manager to enhance and optimize Customer   Relationship Management (CRM) and Marketing Automation (MA) systems including   automation, configurations, correspondences/notifications, custom fields,   integrations, workflows, etc.; collaborate to gather and validate systems   requirements based on business and department needs; evaluate and prepare system   optimizations; partner with HRIS and Enterprise Application teams on   configurations and integrations between HR and TA systems; proactively   configure systems based on business drivers and day-to-day systems   optimization; consult, design, implement and provide solutions and   efficiencies; ensure TA systems meet all data privacy, compliance and   regulations.   Business Analysis  Drive effective business requirement gathering, communication, collaboration and   commitment across multiple teams with competing priorities; build consensus on   operational and technical decisions, while delivering high quality results;   increase the productivity of internal teams by suggesting design and workflow   improvements and fixes; configurations to optimize evolving recruiting needs   and processes.   Provides consultation and support to TA leadership and staff for Providence St. Joseph   Health and affiliates/ministries. Perform all duties in a manner that reflects   the Providence St. Joseph Health mission, philosophy, and core values.   KeyResponsibilities:  The primary job functions include, but are not limited to the following:  Functions as a subject matterexpert (SME) for Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and MarketingAutomation (MA) systems as well as actively participates in theiroptimization to ensure efficient operations, processing, report generationand to enhance candidate/customer experience Drives the definition andorganization of business requirements including process workflows and userscenarios/stories for CRM and MA system change requests In partnership with teammates,develops and conducts ongoing system wide recruiter and customer trainingassociated with technology and process changes Functions as the CRM and MAsystems expert, managing talent acquisition help tickets to ensure timelyissue resolution Acts as a resource for systemand design questions for all existing and proposed CRM and MA systems Develops and works with theemployment brand team to communicate system changes Works with local, regional andsystem leadership and project teams to identify, design, test andimplement new systems or improvements to existing systems and associatedprocedures Investigates, resolves, andperforms follow up tasks on process and system related problems Executes testing to validatesystem fixes are complete, accurate, and function as designed; updatingprocess documentation and supporting materials in a timely manner Responsible for integrity ofsystem settings and data structure as the CRM and MA system administrator Performsother duties as assigned  Qualifications:  Required qualifications for this position include: Bachelors degree in HumanResource Management, Business Administration, Computer Science, InformationSystems or a related field. Equivalent work experience may substitute for the degree requirement. Five years of experience withrecruitment Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), Customer RelationshipManagement (CRM), Marketing Automation (MA) or HR systems Five years of experience withthe design, development, implementation or optimization of systems acrossthe software development lifecycle; experience consulting on technologysolutions, and building business requirements and process improvement Five years of experience inproject management and leading cross-functional projects and or/systemsimplementations, optimizations, or upgrades in a large company with 5000employees Two years of experiencedeveloping reports in an enterprise reporting tool with proficientknowledge of relationship databases and business intelligence systems Intermediate to advanced Microsoftapplications experience such as: Excel, OneNote, Outlook, PowerPoint,SharePoint, Word, etc. Demonstrated knowledge of projectmanagement methodology Ability to write technical andprocess flow documentation to support training for recruitment staff andcustomers Ability to prioritize andorganize short-term and long-term responsibilities in response to changingdemands; must meet tight deadlines and meeting schedules In-depth knowledge of Human Resourcespolicies and procedure  Preferred qualifications for this position include: Avature or other related CRM (Dynamics, Oracle Sales Cloud, Salesforce, etc.) experience Avature or other CRM System Administrator certification Marketing Automation (MA) systems experience (Oracle Eloqua, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Emma, etc.) Other HR, TA, Sales or Marketing systems and solutions experience video interviewing, mobile applications, artificial intelligence, etc. Knowledge of HTML and writing basic SQL  About the department you will serve:  Providence   St. Joseph Health Talent Acquisition is a world-class health care recruitment   system leveraging data and innovation to create a streamlined hiring   experience. In 2018, we will hire over 35,000 employees across our family of   six brands in Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and   Washington. Our accolades given by Lean Human Capital include the 2017 Elite   Honor Roll award for overall top performance in responsiveness, process,   efficiency, cost and quality of hire and the 2017 Raving Fan awards for   excellence in hiring manager and candidate satisfaction scores. As leaders in   health care recruitment, we are shaping the health care landscape by fostering   an organization where our employees can flourish and grow, ensuring we achieve   our Mission and promise: Simplify health for everyone.   A   vital function of Providence St. Joseph Health Talent Acquisition, the Strategy   and Brand team creates, implements and evaluates sourcing and employment brand   strategies to meet the systems diverse talent acquisition needs, providing   data and analyses to influence hiring and the organizations talent landscape   perception. As recognized leaders in the health care recruitment industry, our   integrated hiring solutions reflect the varied backgrounds and experience of   our leadership team in industries such as retail, online advertising and   consulting. In 2018, Providence St. Joseph Health integration projects will   focus on technology, operations, strategy implementation and process   improvement initiatives enabling acquisition of the highest quality,   Mission-inspired workforce.   We offer a full comprehensive range of benefits - see our website for details  Our Mission  As expressions of Gods healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.   About Us  Providence Health & Services is a not-for-profit Catholic network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services guided by a Mission of caring the Sisters of Providence began over 160 years ago. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.   Schedule:  Full-time   Shift:  Day   Job Category:  Information Technology

Recommend solutions based on data analysis to increase business efficiency and/or improve existing processes. Participate in internal and external project workgroup(s) and presentations. Description  This position is responsible for coordination of the required functionality requirements in accordance with organizational needs for all ORACLE Human Capital Management (HCM) resource functions including employee records, employee and retiree benefit administration, compensation management and performance management. Oversee the specification, development and implementation of system, reports, business process, departmental policies and procedures.  Ensure a commitment to safety through consistent and professional behaviors in performance of job requirements that demonstrate safety is a fundamental value that guides all aspects of our work. Perform duties as assigned.    Essential Functions  1. Lead the development, implementation and strategy of Oracle HCM & OAB and related HR requirements and systems. Develop, design, test and implement system upgrades and patches to meet the changing needs and requirements of Agency. Troubleshoot and resolve issues. 2. Manage administration and maintenance of Oracle security access, security protocols and programs related to Oracle HR and Benefits. 3. Maintain database integrity and protocols. Perform regular audits of data to ensure integrity. 4. Manage and coordinate all electronic interfaces of HR data, both in-bound and out-bound. Provide file uploads and downloads as requested. 5. Partner with HR leadership to define and continuously improve HR processes and work flows. 6. Provide ad-hoc, monthly and annual reports and queries from various platforms such as EiS or PEG Board. Conduct trend analysis of HR data. 7. Partner with IT, Finance, Payroll, and HR in developing Agency-wide Oracle business processes to improve accuracy of data and efficiency. 8. Deliver system and end-user training for HR staff.    Position Requirements  Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or related technical field. A minimum of eight (8) years total credited experience. Comparable level experience in Oracle Human Capital and Advanced Benefits, 11.5 and R12 Oracle EBS environments.  Or any equivalent of training and experience.   Selection Criteria  Type of Position / Grade / FLSA:  Grade 16, Exempt, Non-Union, Full-Time Salary Range: Minimum: $83,452.00 Midpoint: $104,315.00 Maximum: $125,178.00 Selection Process   – Candidates will be selected based at a minimum on the result of:  1. Application Review/  Please Include : Cover Letter and Resume 2. Panel Interview 3. Reference Check Supplemental Information:  Make sure you describe in detail how your education, training and work experience fit with this role. You are encouraged to attach a resume, cover letter, training certificates and/or letters of recommendation with your application. You are permitted five attachments of less than 5MB each.   Internal applicants: Information in your personnel file will not be used in lieu of information requested on your application. Incomplete applications will not be considered.  If you are a qualified veteran and would like to apply for veterans' preference points, you will need to reflect your status on the application and attach supporting documentation at the time of application submission.  If you need accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act for any part of the application process, contact our Human Resources staff at 503-962-7505, or the TTY line at 7-1-1. Note that we require a minimum of two workdays' notice prior to the need for accommodation.   TriMet is an equal opportunity employer, committed to developing an organization that is reflective of and sensitive to the needs of the diverse community we serve, including veterans, the elderly, and individuals with disabilities.

Job Title: Senior AML Project Analyst - Corporate %26 Commercial Banking - Minneapolis, Charlotte
Description: U.S. Bank's Corporate and Commercial Banking (CCB) business line offers lending, equipment financing, leasing, depository services, treasury management, capital markets, and international trade services to middle market commercial, large corporate, institutional, and public-sector clients. Corporate and Commercial Banking Risk Management (CCBRM) works with the business to help identify, control and monitor the risks inherent to its activities.   Corporate & Commercial Banking Risk Management (CCBRM) is seeking a strong candidate to join our growing team of risk management professionals. This position is part of the Financial Crimes Control (FCC) team in CCBRM and will support various aspects of the FCC program including, but not limited to: development of reporting and tracking processes to manage projects of varying size, analysis of customer and other related data to help manage business risk, and other reporting/data analytics as requested. The role may also participate in development of business line-specific system requirements, and development of test scripts related to KYC system of record updates.   The role will work directly with varying levels of internal and external business partners, product groups and technical resources to ensure goals are achieved.   The incumbent will be primarily responsible for assisting the Project Manager on projects assigned to the AML CCB Project Team. This includes, but is not limited to, creating and maintaining project plans, and working with other units to automate or generate reporting as needed. The position will also assist with other anti-money laundering compliance initiatives, reporting activities, etc. as needed by providing support to the AML Risk Manager and Project Manager.  Completing-in-depth analytical reviews on data collected/gathered by business line partners and by US Bank systems, noting anomalies and/or incomplete data. Reconciling data for reporting; applying quantitative and quality review methods to ensure accuracy. Developing and implementing action plans based on analysis. Documenting and maintaining robust evidence to support completion of action plans. Monitoring the reporting tools for stability and working with the proper parties when challenges arise. Escalating issues to senior team members and/or management as needed. . Managing time sensitive processes; tracking daily status; and communicating effectively.  Basic Qualifications  Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience Five to seven years of experience in an applicable risk management environment, including project management  Preferred Skills/Experience  Ability to multi task, and prioritize to meet tight deadlines. Strong organizational and project management skills, attention to detail, and ability to follow required procedures. Strong PC skills; ability to learn specific applications as needed. Strong communication skills: oral and written. Solid understanding of the WebKYC system, BSA/AML and OFAC policies and their practical application. Proven track record of defining problems, gathering data, and drawing valid conclusions. Ability to manage multiple priorities and high-volume workload, knowing when to escalate. Knowledge of Corporate & Commercial products and services. Professional certifications (e.g. CAMS, etc.) SDL2017

Job Title: SQL Server Data and Analytics Specialist
Description: Job ID: 36990 ***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***   SQL Server Data and Analytics Specialist  Our client is seeking an SQL Server Data and Analytics Specialist to join their team in Beaverton, OR. This role will work as part of a high functioning team, tasked with supporting day to day operations of a busy Legal Services project, analyzing and maintaining very large transactional datasets in SQL Server.  Responsibilities  Develop, debug and test TSQL code in appropriate environments.   Independently define and develop solutions, with minimal direction, for a wide range of technical and analytical problems.   Participate in team meetings and other collaborations, as well as design and peer reviews.   Be flexible; prepared to approach things laterally; able to think outside the box.   Interface with business stakeholders, to identify or clarify requirements in order to address various questions/problems.   Develop analytical strategies to analyze and interpret data in support of discovery efforts.   Manage and prioritize assigned tasks, ensuring deadlines are achieved, communicating appropriately progression and/or impedances.  Qualifications  Knowledge and experience of the Payment Card Industry is preferred but not required.   Experience creating and supporting complex SQL Server objects, batch processes and batch scripts.   Experience performing complex data analysis of very large datasets.   Experience tuning TSQL queries.   Experience using SQL Server error handling.   Experience using source control.   Experience following change release processes.   Ability to understand complex business processes and adapt solutions to meet the needs of the business.   Excellent communication skills for interaction with peers, managers and business stakeholders.   Must enjoy and have experience working in a fast-paced environment.   Ability to quickly realign with shifting priorities.  Technical Skills  Advanced knowledge and experience working in Microsoft SQL Server 2012 (or later) and TSQL required.   Advanced Database performance tuning skills preferred.   Experience working with very large datasets of 10TB or more.   Integrated Services (SSIS) or other Extract Transform & Load (ETL) experience a plus.   Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and Team Foundation Services (TFS) experience a plus. Benefits  Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k.  About VanderHouwen  VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.  *If interested, please include a brief explanation of your experience with the qualifications below. This information is helpful for the end client to review.**

Overview   Are you a curious, data driven analyst with a proven track record providing high-level budgetary, management, and financial expertise in the preparation of a complex budget? Do you have strong technical and analytical skills; as well as, excellent customer service and relationship-building skills? Are you excited by the idea of working in a public sector environment where you are encouraged and empowered to constantly improve processes?   If so, then your search may be over.   Multnomah County's Central Budget Office is seeking an experienced Budget Analyst Senior to join it's team. In this role you will:  Assist in the preparation of the County's annual budget and support the Chair, Board of County Commissioners, and County leadership with their budgeting decisions. Assist with budget and financial systems trainings. Prepare or lead complex, countywide studies, and projects related to financial and operational issues and budget development. Analyze potential impacts from County policy and state legislative changes. Perform ad hoc budget and financial analyses and forecasts. Monitor budgeted expenditures and revenues versus actuals. Provide costing support for labor negotiations during collective bargaining. Provide data-driven, strategic advice regarding County finances and operations. Prepare reports, memos, graphics, and tables to communicate results of analyses. Present orally and in writing the results of complex financial analysis and recommendations to internal and external audiences. Maintain spreadsheets and assist with maintenance and support of County-wide budget and financial systems. Serve as a technical resource and management consultant to County departments. Assist in the development of communication strategies, process design and planning support. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with Department of County Management leaders, Elected Officials, and other County Department Directors and leaders.  The successful candidate will possess the following attributes:  Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills. Strong analytical skills. Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with internal/external customers and stakeholders.  Our Team   The Budget Office plans, coordinates, and prepares the annual County budget, financial forecasts and budget projections, ad hoc analyses for County decision-makers, cost control analyses, and monthly expenditure and revenue monitoring reports. Budget staff serve on countywide task forces related to budget, finance, and other fiscal matters; identify and resolve financial problems; and partner with County Labor Relations in collective bargaining research, analysis, and in preparing labor cost projections.   Diversity and Inclusion: At Multnomah County, we don't just accept difference; we value it and support it to create a culture of dignity and respect for our employees. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. To Qualify   We will consider any combination of relevant work experience, volunteering, education, and transferable skills as qualifying unless an item or section is labeled required. Please be clear and specific about how your background is relevant. For details about how we typically screen applications, review our overview of the selection process page.  Minimum Qualifications/Transferable Skills: Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, statistics, business administration, public administration or related field. Four (4) years of progressively responsible budgeting, financial management, business or related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.  Preferred Qualifications/Transferable Skills: You do not need to have the following preferred qualifications/transferable skills to qualify. However, keep in mind we may consider some or all of the following when identifying the most qualified candidates. Please clearly explain on your application how you meet any of the following preferred qualifications/transferable skills.  Master's degree highly desirable. Expertise in ERP systems (SAP/Workday), spreadsheets (Excel), pivot tables, databases (SQL Server), and publishing and data visualization software. Advanced principles and practices of governmental finance, budgeting and auditing. Experience and training in the principles and techniques of budget and financial analysis with specialized knowledge and experience in government financial planning and operations, strategic planning, and/or policy analysis. Advanced principles and practices of governmental finance, budgeting and auditing. Interpreting and applying budget-related laws, ordinances, rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Principles of public policy and financial analysis, including the knowledge of legislative processes and law. Analyzing, organizing and interpreting data from various sources and drawing logical conclusions. Transferable skills: Your transferable skills are any skills you have gained through education, work experience (including the military) or life experience that are relevant for this position. Be sure to describe any transferable skills on your application and clearly explain how they apply to this position.  Screening and Evaluation   Application Requirements: The application packet consists of the following:  A short online application. A Resume - attach to the online application. A Cover Letter: Describing why you are interested in the position, what unique talent, skills and background makes you an ideal candidate for this position, and highlighting your experience.  The Selection Process: We expect to evaluate candidates as follows:  Initial review of minimum qualifications Cover Letter and Resume review Consideration of top candidates Background, reference, and education checks Additional Information  Type of Position: This salaried classified management position is not eligible overtime.   Veterans' Preference: Under Oregon Law, qualifying veterans may apply for veterans' preference for this recruitment. Review our veterans' preference website for details about eligibility and how to apply.   Accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act: We gladly provide reasonable accommodation to anyone whose specific disability prevents them from completing an application or participating in this recruitment process. Please contact the recruiter below in advance to request assistance. Individuals with hearing or speech impairments may contact the recruiter through the Telecommunications Relay Service by dialing 711.  What We Can Offer You: Health insurance (medical, vision, Rx, and dental). Qualify for a defined benefit pension after five years of vesting; we pick up the employee's share of the retirement contribution (6% of subject wages). Generous paid leave and the ability to maintain a great work/life balance. Life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Option to participate in deferred compensation, flexible spending accounts. Occasional telecommuting and flexible work schedules. Limited travel, primarily local. Access to a free bus pass for the Portland metropolitan area. Professional development opportunities. Wellness resources.  Work Location: 501 SE Hawthorne Blvd   Questions?   Carey Burney, Recruiter Department of County Assets   501 SE Hawthorne Blvd, Suite 400   Portland, OR 97214   carey.n.burney@multco.us  503-988-7572  Disclaimer: This announcement is intended as a general descriptive recruitment guide and is subject to change. It does not constitute either an expressed or implied contract.

As Columbia’s Senior Global Logistics Analyst you will   manage all logistics data, ensuring data quality is maintained while driving   process improvements in data flow. You will serve as the key liaison between   the business and global information system (GIS) teams as we envision and enable   new functionality, system enhancements and varied technical projects. You will be responsible for ensuring the highest level of   ASN (advanced shipping notice) accuracy by uncovering current ASN errors and   preventing future errors through root-cause analysis and proactive prevention   and detection through reports and expertise. You will also prepare and lead meetings related to data   quality, project updates and proactive communication of progress and challenges  to management teams and partners. Responsibilities: Leverage subject matter expertise to   drive logistics data strategy and process improvement Act as a resource for internal and   external stakeholders impacted by logistics data flow Participate   in and lead miscellaneous projects, as directed by Global Logistics leadership,   leveraging technical knowledge to inform and execute projects to implement   new technical systems and enhance existing systems. Responsible for maximizing data   quality in JDE and SAP for all Global Logistics functions. This includes   entry of shipments in-transit, correction of containers put in transit,   manual processing of shipments to correct status for carriers, creation of   inbound delivery & shipment documents, maintenance of system errors,   etc. Maintain general ASN and data   quality, to include creation and maintenance of error logs, analysis of   error trends (including recommendations to proactively prevent future   errors), creation of reports or scorecards to monitor improvements in ASN   performance, participate or lead meetings with various internal and/or   external stakeholders to help drive ASN improvements as well as providing   metrics for review with logistics providers during regular business   reviews. Drive business process reviews to   capture standard operating procedure as well as to uncover issue root   causes or improvement opportunities. Support new LSP EDI set up,   testing, and connectivity, and other SAP table maintenance as required. Manage customer changes in demand   and delivery by constant communication across Columbia integrated teams; Customer   Service, Acct Logistics and Inbound Logistics. Primary point of contact with our   carriers and/or providers regarding EDI. Primary point of contact for   internal EDI and ABAP teams for issue resolution and project support. Act as lead and subject matter   expert for Columbia’s Transportation Management System (TMS) Train and onboard new members of   the team as necessary Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Business,   International Trade or related field 5+ years’ experience in global   logistics or supply chain SAP knowledge required Proficiency in Microsoft Excel   required Knowledge of Customs and shipping   procedures highly desired TMS experience desired  This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.   EEO/AA Employer/Vets/Disabled/Race/Ethnicity/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Age   OTS-COL

Honor the Promise. At Argo Group, that is what our US Claims team of approximately 200 employees does each and every day. When the unexpected happens, our Adjusters honor the promise of our insurance policy and do our part to get our insured back to business. With paramount integrity and technical excellence, our Claims team delivers superior financial results to all stakeholders of the claim. We hire the best people, so we can deliver the best result. We are looking for an exceptional Senior Claims Solutions Analyst to join our team and work in one of the following Argo offices: Alpharetta (GA), Chicago (IL), Denver (CO), Peoria (IL), Milwaukie (OR), Richmond (VA), Richmond (VA), San Antonio (TX), or Scottsdale (AZ). So what’s it like to work on the Argo Group US Team? Well, it’s different, and different can be good. We do not treat our claims or our claims professionals as a commodity. The work we offer is challenging and diversified. Our Adjusters and Managers are empowered to exercise their independent discretion and, within broad limits and authority, be creative in developing solutions and treat each case as the unique situation it is. We have a very flat organizational structure, so that our Adjusters and Managers have more opportunities to interact with our senior management team, especially when it comes to reviewing large losses. Our entire claims team works in a collaborative nature to expeditiously resolve claims. We offer a work environment that inspires innovation and is open to employee suggestions, even offering a reward for the best creative idea each quarter. We allow fully performing employees the flexibility to work from their home up to two days a week once they have been fully trained. While we work hard, a work/life balance is just as important so that our employees are fully focused while working. Sound like a team you would like to join? First  you’ll want to make sure you embody our core values as they are the key to our success: We desire to excel We are committed to our clients and to each other We have the courage to do the right thing We apply original thinking Second , you’ll want to make sure the challenge sounds interesting to you. In this role you will: Gather and manipulate claims data from multiple operating systems, conduct analysis, identify trends, and summarize findings to “tell the story behind the numbers”. Support U.S. Claims compliance with governance related directives and assist Claims Compliance and Data Manager with projects on an as-needed basis Manage the Reporting Calendar to ensure an equitable distribution of work within data team Mentor solutions-oriented staff and ensure team collaboration on data and compliance related initiatives What will you need to be successful here?  A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university At least five (5) years’ prior experience focused on data and compliance in a claims environment or other equivalent experience working with data gathering and analysis. Proficient in MS Office Suite (particularly Access and Excel) and other business-related software. Prior experience with data profiling software is required, specifically: Ability to read, understand and develop SQL code Experience with data mining and profiling along with an ability to perform analysis across data groups Understanding of claims compliance reporting and analysis Must be able to perform work under moderate supervision and work within specific limits and authority on assignments of moderate technical complexity.  Will be responsible for mentoring and developing colleagues abilities in the areas of claims data and compliance reporting Ability to quickly evaluate the accuracy of data and information. Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and handle multiple projects simultaneously Strong customer focus – with the ability to work directly with internal and external partners Desire to work in a fast paced environment. Polished and professional written and verbal communication skills. The ability to read and write English fluently is required.  What will we provide to you? An opportunity to be your best and work with talented and inventive professionals at a Company Forbes magazine named to its list of America’s 50 Most Trustworthy Financial Companies for the last two years and that A.M. Best has rated an ‘A’ (Excellent) for 13 consecutive years. An attractive Total Rewards package that includes: Base pay and profit sharing. Comprehensive benefits designed to protect and enhance your life and your dependents’ lives by way of health and wellness plans, life insurance, a matching 401(k) Plan, generous PTO and an opportunity to become a shareholder at a 15% discount. Argo Academy, a digital and instructor-led platform that helps us focus on continuous learning and which, by the way, got us named in Training magazine as one of the 2017 Training Top 125 Companies! Opportunities to support your local community though various outreach programs or by matching your gift to charitable causes by 150%. An Employee Referral program, that resulted in 30% of all new hires last year. Who are we? Argo Group, through its operating subsidiaries, offers high-quality Commercial Property and Casualty (P&C) insurance products and services tailored to the needs of businesses and public entities. At Argo Group, we leverage the success, discipline and expertise of our people and an understanding of our customers’ needs to provide a diverse portfolio of products and services. This approach helps those we insure drive down their ultimate cost through prevention and aggressive claims handling. Simply stated, our products and services help keep businesses in business. Argo’s success is directly linked to the intellect, commitment and enthusiasm of our team members. We take the time to hire high-potential individuals, and we invest substantially in their ideas and ambitions. Passion for excellence is the foundation for building a strong and profitable company. At Argo Group, we seek the industry’s best talent and offer the optimal specialty insurance career opportunities to people who: Strive to exceed expectations Are guided by a deep sense of ethics Focus on understanding our clients’ need And now our legal disclosures, because, well, there are always legal disclosures. Salary: $30,000.00 - $38,000.00 Annually   Position Reports to: Digital Strategist & PPC Team Lead   Positions That Report to You: none   Classification: Exempt - Full Time   Intuitive Digital is an exciting and fast-growing digital marketing agency in Portland. We are looking for an upbeat, intelligent, self-motivated and happy person to help with our fast-growing Digital Marketing company. Joining the Intuitive team means you are joining the family. Have you seen us in the news lately? Recently, we were the winners of the 2017 and 2018 Portland Business Journal Oregon's 100 Fastest Growing Companies (#16 and #57!), the 2017 and 2018 Healthiest Employers of Oregon, the 2016 AMA Jr. Search Marketer of the Year, the 2016 BBB Torch Awards for Ethics, and the 2016 US Search Awards for Young Search Professional. We were also finalists for the 2016 Search Engine Land Award for Best Overall SEM Initiative. Want to see what our real culture is like? Check out this video!   Job Objective:   We strive to produce the highest quality product for our partners by identifying and achieving their pay per click advertising goals.   Primary Responsibilities:  Build and manage paid search campaigns on Google, Bing, and paid social media channels Setting up new PPC accounts Daily management of PPC accounts, including, budget management, bid management, ad copy testing, landing page optimization, etc. Analyzing data to develop effective strategies to help partners reach their ongoing goals Researching and implementing new PPC tactics and strategies Help partners and the team understand the reasoning behind your strategy Build weekly and monthly KPI reports to communicate performance trends and developments Share your expertise through Intuitive blog posts, whitepapers, etc Work closely with team members to meet client goals  Secondary or Support Responsibilities:  Provide data, research and strategy support for partner teams and new business opportunities Participating in new business pitches and creative brainstorms Building Intuitive Digital into a national brand over the next 10 years by achieving our BHAG – to become the most reviewed, highest rated digital marketing agency in the U.S. Internal social media marketing efforts Other duties as may be determined Requirements  Qualifications:  0-1 year of PPC experience – agency experience is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel Excellent writer and communicator – digital analyst will be client facing at times Bachelor's degree in advertising, marketing, business or related field Self-starter, attention to detail and reliable  Preferred Qualifications:  AdWords and Bing Ads Certified Shopping campaigns creation and optimization, including experience creating and managing Google Merchant Center and product feeds Experience with AdWords Editor and other PPC tools Agency tools (e.g., Dropbox, project management software and Harvest or other time tracking software) Google Analytics Certification Google Tag Manager Certification Experience with social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+, HootSuite) Experience writing blog posts (e.g., WordPress) Experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop  Physical Demands:  Ability to sit for long periods of time. Ability to lift and carry 25-30 lbs. Ability to perform repetitive hand movements for long periods of time. Benefits Health insurance, 401K matching, professional development budget, optional voluntary insruance 2 weeks of accrued paid time off in the first year of employment, 3 weeks years 2-5, and 4 weeks years 5+ 4 days a year of volunteer/philanthropic PTO. We at Intuitive recognize that building a better world depends upon each of us contributing our time and energy outside of our professional time and we are committed to enabling our employees to make that happen Chair Massages 9 paid holidays Top of the line computer (Apple MacBook Pro) Company outings Bonus structure for individuals bringing in new business Purpose Driven Organization:  Our purpose as a business is to  cultivate happiness  with our partners, vendors, and community. We help our partners grow by freeing them up to focus on what makes them happy, whether that be spending more time with family, increasing profits, or growing their business. We focus on improving our outward and inward practice of this principle each and every day.  Intuitive Digital Values:  Our values were chiseled out of the bedrock of our collective experience and ground down to actionable phrases. (translation: these are important)  Build Long-Term Relationships is the practice of seeking first to understand before being understood, communicating effectively, providing excellent service, and always going the distance for a team member or partner. Do What’s Right is the practice of being honest, taking responsibility for mistakes, and always fighting for the best solution on behalf of partners. Create Fun is the practice of making space for play, showcasing a culture of fun, and understanding that work is a joyful privilege. Continuous Improvement is the practice of bringing a spirit of learning into every single day, improving a process every time it is touched, making every account a success that can be shared, and admitting that there is a more effective way to do everything.  Want to see what our real culture is like? Check out this video!

Tasks  When you join Daimler, you become a brand ambassador for a diverse global network of over 250,000 committed employees on 6 continents. Our employees drive the future of innovation in each of our world-class brands, including Freightliner trucks, Western Star trucks, Detroit engines and components, Thomas Built Buses, and Freightliner Custom Chassis.   Daimler Trucks North America (DTNA) is the undisputed leader in the commercial vehicle market. We are elevating the industry by setting the bar for quality and execution. Our DTNA employees are empowered to drive the Technology Revolution through our innovative products and customer-focused culture. Our dedication to our customers does not stop once our products hit the road. We immerse ourselves in the customers experience and what drives their business toward the future.   Daimler. One Team. Best Team.   Driven to connect our world. Apply today!   Job Overview   Freightliner New Trucks Controlling partners with Freightliner Sales & Marketing to maximize the overall   financial performance of Freightliner Trucks by managing the reporting of truck sales and profit margins   and providing analytical support in developing operating forecasts, plans and performance targets.  Responsibilities  The Revenue Controlling team is focused primarily on the drivers of contribution margin from both the revenue and cost perspectives as well as providing controlling review regarding adherence to approved transaction guidelines.   Create monthly Canadian Revenue forecast including analysis to prevent over hedging, by partnering with Accounting and Treasury. Provide the monthly Canadian Hedging KPI deck and recommend improvements as needed.   Support Sales and Marketing by providing a Business Unit Review each month by analyzing large volumes of invoiced data to identify any trends driving contribution margin change.   Provide the sales and marketing team with the monthly backlog forecast analyzing large volumes of invoiced and backlog data.   Support Top Customer Playbook process through data collection and analysis/forecasting.   Collaborate with members of controlling, accounting, sales and marketing on various projects arising from the day to day requirements of the position.   Support of OP/EA planning and Ad-hoc reporting projects as required.   Qualifications  - Bachelors degree in accounting, finance, or business with 2 years of related experience OR an associates degree with 4 years of related experience OR 8 years of related experience required. Master's degree preferred  At least 1 year of group leader, project lead, or mentoring experience required An attached resume is required Financial analysis experience in revenue analysis, pricing, accounting or related required Experience in currency exchange, hedging, cash flow development preferred. Excellent MS Excel and Access skills including ability to write macros and use pivot tables required Strong analytical skills required Current knowledge of IFRS/GAAP preferred Excellent communication skills required Ability to identify issues quickly and effectively communicate key issues to management required Additional Information Applicants must be legally authorized to work permanently in the U.S. at the time of application Final candidate must successfully complete a pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check EEO/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans  For an accommodation or special assistance with applying for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department at 503-745-8982 or toll free 800-206-3369. For TTY/TDD enabled call 503-745-2137 or toll free 866-355-6935.

If you want to make a positive difference and stand out from the crowd, you’ll fit in at The Standard (www.standard.com). Through our retirement plans and insurance products and services, we help people achieve financial well-being and peace of mind. Come join us and share our passion for serving our customers in a positively different way.   The Portfolio Analyst is a member of the Investment Management team primarily responsible for four functional areas:   1. Performing issue, opportunistic and market research   2. Conducting portfolio-level performance analytics and contributing to performance reports   3. Developing and improving financial and operating models used in support of investment evaluation, asset and portfolio monitoring and capital markets trading (fixed income and derivatives)   4. Contributing analytic, mathematic, programming and modeling work to ensure the alignment of investment function with the various data and information requirements of clients’ asset and liability management.   Candidates will work with a cross-section of professionals, including principal investment professionals, actuaries, accountants and product development teams to optimize investment outcomes for both public and private investment strategies.   25% Lead analysis in support of benchmarking, attribution analysis, portfolio allocations, rebalancing and asset ratings migration. Work with senior leaders in the investment management team to design, build and execute portfolio optimization framework. Disseminate market information to clients, business partners and others as needed.   50% Lead efforts for the investment management team in the review and design improvements of credit and investment analytical tools. Work with investment staff to develop analytics for new business lines. Utilize modeling and analytical reporting to help understand portfolio performance.   15% Improve operational efficiencies within investment team to enable portfolio optimization. Often involved in processes and developing tools to streamline analytics processes and support.   10% Perform special analyses in response to market events, new business needs and client requests. Perform analysis and/or research related to special projects as directed, and other work as assigned.  Qualifications:  (Education, experience, special skills, languages or licenses/certifications required) Education: Bachelor’s degree in math, economics, or business; CFA or progress toward certification. 2+ years of relevant work experience in a principal investment business or a capital markets business. Demonstrated & strong financial modeling & analytical skills applied in an investment or capital market business environment, with significant expertise in United States capital markets.   Position has preference for familiarity with Bloomberg and one of the major fixed income analytics software program (FactSet, Aladdin, Bond Edge, etc.) Requires significant expertise in Microsoft Excel and financial modeling. Project management and operating model experience is a plus. Requires detail orientation and self-motivation while working in a team-oriented environment. Job Summary: * Videos * Duties Help ## Duties ### Summary This position is located in Power and Operations Planning (PGP) organization of Generation Asset Management (PG), Power Services (P), Bonneville Power Administration (BPA). Power and Operations Planning (PGP) provides loads and resource planning estimates for a variety of planning and operational purposes, ranging from long term (10 years into the future on a regional basis) to near term (Federal inventory based on current water supply and operating requirements.) Learn more about this agency ### Responsibilities **As an Operations Research Specialist****, you will:** Serve as a senior analyst and technical lead, plans and carries out complete technical assignments that involve initiating, applying, and planning major developmental studies; serving as a consultant and technical advisor to senior subject matter specialists and/or BPA and agency officials responsible for broad program operations; providing significant and innovative recommendations for advancing programs and/or methods; using new analytical developments and modified processes to resolve novel or obscure problems that affect broad program operations; evaluating the data resulting from applying mathematical or statistical tools, models, methods, and techniques; and acting as the authoritative source of technical input to publications or other documents that are the basis for formulating policy. You are primarily responsible for a major function on behalf of the US Entity, such as analyzing, planning, negotiating and implementing within-year operations under the Columbia River Treaty or serving as Secretary to the U.S. Entity with responsibility for giving support and advice to senior leadership (up to the Administrator of BPA and the Division Engineer at the Corps of Engineers) and coordinating between the Canadian Entity, the U.S. Entity, the Department of State, and other Federal agencies. This is a temporary promotion, not to exceed one (1) year, may be extended up to five (5) years total; may be made permanent. Upon termination of the promotion, you will be returned to your original position or record, or to a different position of equivalent grade and pay. Temporary promotions may be terminated at any time based on the needs of management. If you are currently employed at the grade equivalent to, or higher than the advertised position, the action will be considered a detail for processing purposes, and no salary increase will be associated with accepting the position. Details are processed in 120 day increments and may be extended up to two (2) years total; additional extensions may be approved at the discretion of the Human Resources Service Center Director. Upon termination of the detail, you will be returned to your original position of record. Details may be terminated at any time based on the needs of management. ### Travel Required Occasional travel - Occasional Travel is required to various BPA location for meetings. ##### Supervisory status No ##### Promotion Potential 13 * #### Job family (Series) 1515 Operations Research * Requirements Help ## Requirements ### Conditions of Employment * You must be a United States Citizen. * This employer participates in the e-Verify program. * Males must abide by Selective Service registration requirements. **OTHER REQUIREMENTS:** * Selectee will be required to complete the Office of Government Ethics Standard of Confidential Financial Disclosure Report (OGE450e) within 30 days of employment and annually. * When you apply you will be asked a series of questions to determine your eligibility for employment and your qualification for this position specifically. You must answer all of these questions completely and truthfully. * A preliminary background check must be completed before a new employee can begin work. Job Title: Information Systems Specialist 7 - Senior Systems Data Analyst
Description: Description Announcement: ODOT18-1496oc Senior Systems Data Analyst – Information Systems Specialist 7   Central Services – IS/TAD Salem    ODOT's Information Systems Branch (ISB) is recruiting for an IS  senior systems data analyst  (information systems specialist 7) to provide senior-level analysis expertise for the Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) program. The Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) unit is responsible for public facing systems like TripCheck.com and the 511 Travel Conditions telephone number. The ITS program supports ODOT's Traveler Information Systems, Incident Management Systems and Traffic Management Systems. In addition, ITS is responsible for many internal mission critical ODOT systems that interact with roadside devices such as video cameras, digital freeway signs, ramp meters, and more. ODOT operations staff use these systems to communicate weather, incident and other event information with both the public and regional emergency responders.   The primary purpose of this position is to provide systems analysis expertise and leadership for new development and/or enhancements of ITS information systems. The person in this position is responsible for supporting individuals and project groups through the creation, acquisition, and maintenance of cost-effective and timely computer systems and programs for large client-server systems that affect multiple agencies throughout the state.  We invite members of all diverse communities to join our workforce as we endeavor to best serve Oregonians from every background.ODOT values diversity and inclusion because they are good for Oregon. We believe that by welcoming differences, encouraging new ideas and views, listening to and learning from each other, and providing opportunities for professional enrichment we are better able to serve those around us.We thank you for considering this employment opportunity. Additional Information: Open until-filled:  This announcement will remain open until filled. Your immediate response is requested as this recruitment may close at any time without advance notice at the discretion of the agency after a sufficient number of qualified candidates have applied. Our next screening will be at 8:30 a.m. on  September 25, 2018 Representation:  This position is represented by the Service Employees International Union (SEIU/OPEU).    Duties & Responsibilities Software (Construction) Facilitate stakeholder requirements gather workshops and meetings with business customers.  Organize requirements and collaborate with software developers to ensure functional specifications satisfy approved requirements  Develop test plans and test cases. Conduct functional testing, logging defects and coordinating resolution with the development team. Software (Customer Assistance) Diagnose user problems, up to and including system crashes, and ensure resolution by working with programmers to fix the software.  Analyze business needs for the development of software that changes business processes. Primary responsibility includes software requirements and data analysis.  Diagnose complex system problems and crashes.  Software (Operations) Monitor and evaluate application post-implementation performance and implement application modifications/adjustments as needed.  Identify corrupt or problematic data issues for mission critical systems; evaluate and execute actions to resolve errors.  Contact multiple vendors regarding project related problems and resolve or escalates problems as needed; coordinate with vendors, external agencies, customers and IS to schedule resources to implement solutions. Software (Planning) Collaborate with project stakeholders to document business processes ("as-is" and "to-be") and for new development initiatives.  Work with technical leads and architects to develop alternative solutions by researching existing systems, programs, procedures and pertinent customer data.  Qualifications, Required & Requested Skills  Minimum Qualifications :  (a) Six (6) years of information systems experience in communications, software, hardware, and data.  Communications:  Communication means the connections that link systems and includes voice, data, image, and video.  Software:  Software means the programs, procedures, rules, and associated documentation concerned with operating a system and covers both applications and operating software.  Hardware:  Hardware Device means the physical components (e.g., PC, server, mainframe, peripherals).  Data:  Data means data bases and associated master files.  OR  (b) An Associate's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, OR completion of a two (2) year accredited vocational training program in information technology or related field;  AND  four (4) years of information systems experience in communications, software, hardware, and data.  Communications:  Communication means the connections that link systems and includes voice, data, image, and video.  Software:  Software means the programs, procedures, rules, and associated documentation concerned with operating a system and covers both applications and operating software.  Hardware:  Hardware Device means the physical components (e.g., PC, server, mainframe, peripherals).  Data:  Data means data bases and associated master files.  OR  (c) A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field may substitute for four (4) years.  AND  two (2) years of information systems experience in communications, software, hardware, and data.  Communications:  Communication means the connections that link systems and includes voice, data, image, and video.  Software:  Software means the programs, procedures, rules, and associated documentation concerned with operating a system and covers both applications and operating software.  Hardware:  Hardware Device means the physical components (e.g., PC, server, mainframe, peripherals).  Data:  Data means data bases and associated master files.  OR  (d) Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field may substitute for all of the above.     Desired Attributes/Application Scoring Criteria:  In addition to your related work experience and education, we will use the attributes below to determine whom to interview. You are not required to have all of these attributes, but please make sure that the ones you do have are clearly demonstrated in your application materials. Your application materials may be graded on spelling, grammar, punctuation, and presentation.  Demonstrated experience in facilitating stakeholder requirements-gathering work sessions.  Strong written skills in creating clear and concise requirements, business cases, test cases and test plans.  Experience in performing software testing and bug tracking.  Experience in data modeling or analysis. Working Conditions: Normal office environment working at computer terminal.  Work environment includes managing assignments with conflicting requirements and tight deadlines.  May occasionally work irregular hours (weekends, evenings, holidays and to travel for job related purposes.  Additional Information Application Instructions:  We appreciate your interest in this position. To apply, please submit a resume as described below and answer our supplemental questions. Note that we have disabled several sections of the electronic application. Because of the volume of applications we receive, we do not review attachments we do not ask for.  Resume:  In your resume, you must clearly describe how you meet the qualifications for this position as listed above and include a list of verifiable employers and dates of employment (including month and year). Please title your resume using this format, "[last name]_ODOT18_1496oc_Resume."  Caution:  If you fail to follow these instructions as described above, we will have to disqualify your application. We cannot consider i ncomplete or late applications.    Pre-employment Checks:  We will conduct criminal background checks on final candidates including current ODOT employees. All applicants are subject to additional pre-employment check(s) such as driver license, LEDS, and/or education verification as required for the position.    Veteran's Points :  Eligible veterans who meet the qualifications will be given veterans' preference. To receive preference, veterans must attach appropriate documentation as outlined by the Department of Administrative Services at the following website: Veterans Resources. Please title your DD214 like this, "[Your Last Name] DD214" and your disability letter "[Your Last Name] Disability Letter." Veterans may also call the Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs at 1-800-692-9666.  Note:  DD214 member 1 copies do not contain character of service and cannot be used to verify veterans' preference eligibility. Please attach DD214 member 2 or 4.    Work Authorization:  ODOT does not offer VISA sponsorships. Within three days of hire, successful candidates will be required to complete the US Department of Homeland Security's I-9 form confirming authorization to work in the United States.    Questions and Application Support: For questions about the job announcement, call 503-986-3468 or email odotrecruitmentjf@odot.state.or.us.  For technical help with your login or online application issues, call 1-855-524-5627 from 6:30a to 5:30p PT M-F by leaving a voicemail. It may take up to 24 hrs to receive a response. If you do not receive a response after 24 hours, you can email Technical Support at support@governmentjobs.com.    We encourage you to print and/or save a PDF copy of your application. Job Title: Applications Analyst, Senior - Cerner Laboratory Apps
Description: Description: Providence is calling a Applications Analyst, Senior to Providence Health & Services in Portland, OR or Renton, WA or Burbank, CA or Anchorage, Alaska.  Positions at this level use a wide application of complex principles, theories, and concepts in the specific field, plus may have working knowledge or other related disciplines and provide solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. The individual in this position leads medium to large internal project work teams developing project plans and work plans. This individual also analyzes and evaluates existing or proposed systems and devices or modifies procedures to process data and solve problems. The position requires reviewing schedules, cost and documentation to ensure success of projects. This individual mentors and assists others in support of applications, projects and goals. This person Typically deals with users to determine appropriate requirements of complex systems.  In this position you will: Use in-depth information and analysis to provide management with advice and counsel on a variety of business issues. Issues are often highly technical and complex in nature. Define user requirements for complex systems. Perform highly complex qualitative and/or quantitative analyses. Lead project teams as needed. Identify and create standards and processes to support the application portfolio management. Work with Integration Team to develop processes and procedures designed to improve and maximize support and interaction between analysts and Integration Team.
