Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Business Planning and Analytics
Description: The position is responsible for leading Business Planning & Financial Analytics for Home Printing Solutions (HPS) organization, supporting leadership team of Business Unit (BU) General Manager and the head of BU finance. The job requires financial analysis of current product portfolio which would feed into planning for New Product Introductions (NPI) in outer years. The analysis would also serve as a starting point for bottoms-up financial planning that this position will lead. The key components required to be successful in this position are strategic thinking, ability to perform complex financial analysis, and strong communication skills. The analyst should also be a strong collaborator who can partner with different organizations BU finance, supply chain, customer support, region category, etc. to lead the planning process. Key responsibilities :  Build complex financial models that provide insights into margin profile of current portfolio with detailed analysis of cost structure. The model should have capability to perform bottoms-up financial planning and run sensitivity analysis for different inputs.  Partner with New Product Introduction (NPI) analysts and product management team to drive data-driven, highly accurate assumptions in product performance planning. Partner with supplies organization to create integrated product performance view of Hardware and Supplies. Develop various reports including profitability by business, region, and product segment and aid in using these reports to drive improvements in the business. These reports are done on a monthly and quarterly basis to closely monitor the business results. Perform variance analysis comparing actual performance to budget, last year, and forecast for the different areas of the business that you support. Fully participate in budgeting and forecasting processes. Use Strategic thinking and critical reasoning ability to question everything we do and drive business and team to greater heights. Strong communication skills are a must as this role will work with various levels of management, both in finance and the business, and must be able to clearly relay results of analytical projects as well as monthly and quarterly results. Drive improvements in the financial and reporting processes, and the quality of information provided to the business. Skills required include strong Excel, Access and PowerPoint knowledge with the aptitude to extract information from the existing business systems. Education and Experience Required: First level university degree with a focus in business or economics; advanced degree or accounting certification (e.g., CPA, MBA, CFA) preferred. Typically 6+ years of experience as a financial analyst preferred. Typically experienced in more than one finance function. Knowledge and Skills Required: Excellent financial modeling skills and critical reasoning ability Excellent understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis. Excellent analytical skills. Superior business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel). Superior communication and influencing skills. Superior teamwork skills Excellent business acumen. Excellent project management skills. Primary consideration will be given to candidates in Vancouver, WA #LI-POST

We currently have an opening for a Senior Financial Analyst in our Solon, OH location supporting both the Keithley Instruments (Keithley) and Sonix Product Lines. This position is a primary finance business partner with the VP Keithley, Sonix & Strategic Growth Initiatives, Keithley General Manager, the Sonix VP of Global Marketing & Sales and other product line leaders. Responsibilities include driving business results, and forecasting, analyzing, and communicating business results and plans to management. The person filling this role will have the opportunity to develop through challenging assignments in a team environment while gaining great insight into product development and marketing operations. This role works closely with both the Keithley and the Sonix research & development and product marketing teams as well as the global finance organization.  Key Responsibilities: Leadership: Responsibility for the Keithley and Sonix financials in cooperation with the VP Keithley, Sonix & Strategic Growth Initiatives, Keithley General Manager and Sonix VP of Global Marketing & Sales. This includes: Preparing weekly and monthly financial management reporting, including variance analysis Developing monthly forecasting and yearly planning at both detail and summary levels  Creating overview analyses and executive summaries  Assisting in strategy development, including resource alignment and roadmap creation for execution Generating ad hoc analysis for strategic and operational initiatives Collaboration: Must work across organizational boundaries to drive continuous improvement, develop forecasts & plans, and complete projects in line with company and organizational strategy.  Operational: $200M revenue and $29M expense responsibility for an organization with approximately 210 associates in the US, China and Asia-Pac Provide strong business partnering with the VP Keithley, Sonix & Strategic Growth Initiatives, Keithley General Manager, Keithley Senior Director of Engineering and Sonix VP of Global Marketing & Sales Maintain a strong compliance environment Drive financial performance in a metric-oriented organization Direct and execute measurable actions to drive contribution margin improvements. Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance required. MBA or Master’s degree in Accounting/Finance highly desired Minimum of three years of experience in accounting or financial analyst role required, prefer experience in a multinational accounting or finance reporting environment The successful candidate will also be able to demonstrate the following: Ability to build strong high-level executive and peer relationships in a team environment. Strong business acumen Intellectual curiosity Driver of operational improvements through use of FBS tools  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including ability to balance the achievement of short-term objectives (quarterly orders/sales objectives, expense management, etc.) with longer-term strategic and policy deployment goals Attention to detail to ensure accuracy in business results reporting, forecasting and planning  General knowledge of GAAP and technical accounting skills Proficiency in use of Microsoft Office Products  Due to US Department of Commerce export control regulations governing technical data of Tektronix products, Tektronix needs to know the citizenship of all its employees. Note that US Citizenship is not required for most positions. Hired candidates will be asked to bring proof of citizenship (passport, birth certificate, green card, visa or similar) on their first day of work. All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening, background/criminal check, and if applicable a motor vehicle record search and/or financial record check. Candidates with less education/experience may be considered for other opportunities.

Job Description  JOB TITLE: Payroll and Garnishment Operations Analyst   FLSA CLASSIFICATION: Salaried Exempt To be determined   Incorporated in 1965, Barrett Business Services, Inc. (NASDAQ: BBSI) is a leading provider of business management solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. Our clients are located in 22 states and the District of Columbia, through a network of 55 branches located in California, Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Arizona, Nevada, Utah, Colorado, Maryland, Delaware and North Carolina. We are seeking a Senior Payroll Operations Analyst Lead to join our team at our corporate office, located in Vancouver, Washington. BBSI reported 2015 Revenue of $741 million and the company has been growing 15 to 20% annually. The company reported 2015 diluted EPS of $3.47.   Our employees are motivated through a compensation package that includes a competitive salary, profit sharing, full benefits packages, including health/life insurance and 401(K)/profit sharing plans.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The Payroll and Garnishment Operations Analyst is motivated by the success of BBSIs branches and internal teams. The primary objective of the position is to provide guidance and direction to field payroll teams and internal teams, primarily in the area of payroll, garnishments, taxation and reporting. The primary objective is to ensure effective, compliant and efficient payroll processing for roughly 235,000 employees in partnership with field payroll teams. This position will work closely with the Senior Payroll Operations Analyst to locate bottlenecks in payroll processing and identify areas of improvement in order to maintain efficiency.   This person must demonstrate solid understanding in all areas of payroll, including processing, reporting, systems, taxation of wages, wage and hour laws, time and attendance, garnishment processes, and operational best practices.   REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS: This position reports to the Lead Senior Payroll Operations Analyst and works in partnership with other operations positions, as well as providing direct support and accountability to field teams.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Become an expert in BBSI payroll, timekeeping and HRIS systems and identify systems options to achieve better results for field teams and clients Provide guidance to roughly 200 BBSI payroll professionals located throughout the country on payroll processing, tax laws, systems issues and general troubleshooting in payroll, payroll systems, and garnishments Mentor the internal payroll and garnishment teams Perform voids, payroll adjustments, stop checks, check verifications, garnishments, W-2 and W-2c administration Audit pay codes and deduction codes for data integrity Evaluate current processes and work with the Senior Payroll Operations Analyst to increase efficiency and reliability of the Payroll Department End-of-day ACH/EFT/PosPay processes Enter and respond to garnishment orders Data entry and file maintenance Other duties, projects and responsibilities as assigned CORE TRAITS/COMPETENCIES: Results-oriented, accountable and highly organized Strong client service orientation Stakeholder mentality Embracing of change Innately curious Highly ethical Detail oriented and quality driven High emotional intelligence and effective influencer and communicator  · Highly organized with the ability to efficiently and accurately complete tasks on time with minimal supervision  SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Minimum 7 years of payroll experience in a fast-paced, multi-state, demanding environment Customer service experience strongly preferred Systems orientated including proficiency in MS Excel Knowledge of wage and hour laws, garnishment laws, and taxability of wages Solid understanding of the payroll lifecycle, amendments, and payroll deductions Professional appearance and demeanor Bachelors degree required; CPP, FPC designation or MBA is a plus Extensive third-party payroll experience a plus  Company DescriptionBBSI is a leading provider of business management solutions, combining human resource outsourcing and professional management consulting to create a unique operational platform. Our integrated platform is built upon expertise in payroll, employee benefits, workers' compensation coverage, risk consultation and workplace safety programs, human resource consultation and recruiting. BBSI's partnerships help business owners to focus on their business by eliminating organizational complexity and bringing predictability to the management of their business.

PeaceHealth is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst - Reimbursement Services for a 1.0 full time equivalent Exempt position.  This position will be working Day shift with shift durations of 8 Hours.   Req ID: 164633      JOB SUMMARY  Provides support to assigned internal customer’s business and operational needs, supporting and furthering their goals and priorities within the context of the goals and priorities of the organization and the mission and values of PeaceHealth. Responsible for providing credible and understandable financial analyses and guidance that enhance decision making of assigned internal customers. Collects, analyzes and prepares financial data, analyzes fiscal accounting and related systems, regulatory submissions, fiscal presentations for budget and reimbursement, and financial feasibility studies.       ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Interprets results of clinical data to explain financial outcomes. Defines clinical and operational impacts. Translates operational impacts into financial components. Calculates financial implication to quantify data. Provides dissemination of financial information to promote clarity of understanding, effective operational decision making, and ensure an understanding of the financial ramifications of decision alternatives. Develops and monitors defined metrics that support regional and system wide parameters and in accordance with the planning calendar. Develops and maintains business partner relationships including a detailed understanding of the business units/programs being served as applicable. Provides ongoing financial and variation analysis that will assist management in enhancing operations. Performs data validation and process verification to ensure accuracy and appropriateness of reported information. Prepares special studies which analyze a specific part of the operations as directed. Completes projects to facilitate and enhances the decision making. Prepares and presents financial information to management as requested. Provides financial education as needed or requested. Performs other duties as assigned.     QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field required. MBA is preferred.   EXPERIENCE/TRAINING: Minimum of five years’ progressive experience in an accounting or financial analyst role required. Experience in Healthcare is preferred. Familiarity with computerized accounting systems required. PC spreadsheet experience is required.   LICENSE/CERTIFICATION: CPA preferred.     OTHER SKILLS: Demonstrated ability to act in a consulting capacity Ability to formulate and operationalize new concepts and ideas for improvement Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with multiple demands and short time frames Strong organizational skills and self motivated Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills and the ability to make objective assessments Strong communication skills, both verbal and written Proficient level of technical expertise with various software applications and tools, i.e. Microsoft Suite, Internet browsers, and databases   EGION/LOCATION SPECIFIC NOTES Systems Services: Provides financial planning support to assigned internal customers related to cost accounting and service line profitability Maintains cost accounting system and reports Analyzes, prepares and presents service line, cost accounting and/or detailed patient information and reports to management and/or senior leadership Provides training to cost accounting system users and ongoing customer services     SYSTEM – PHYSICAL / COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS: Work requires fairly light physical exertion from up to 65% of the time. Ability to lift objects weighing 30 lbs. or less. Work is performed under normal working conditions with adequate lighting and ventilation. Job duties frequently require intense concentration and attention to detail (up to 65% of work time).      Please apply online to be considered. For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application.      About PeaceHealth      PeaceHealth, based in Vancouver, Wash., is a not-for-profit Catholic health system offering care to communities in Washington, Oregon, and Alaska. PeaceHealth has approximately 16,000 caregivers, a multi-specialty medical group practice with more than 900 providers and 10 medical centers serving both urban and rural communities throughout the Northwest. In 1890, the Sisters of St. Joseph of Peace founded what has become PeaceHealth. Today, PeaceHealth is the legacy of its founding Sisters and continues with a spirit of respect, stewardship, collaboration and social justice in fulfilling its Mission.        We offer competitive compensation, a robust benefits package and a collaborative, Mission-driven work environment! To learn more about working at PeaceHealth and the Vancouver community please visit our homepage: www.peacehealth.org/careers.       Get a feeling for the Spirit of PeaceHealth through this three-minute video, and visit us on Facebook or LinkedIn!       Questions? Review our Employment FAQ or email Recruitment@peacehealth.org. Please note this email does not accept resumes or applications.      Location:  Vancouver, Shared Services Center (802)  Job Category:  Business, Administrative & Facilities   Shift:  Day  Shift Length:  8 Hours  FTE:  1.0  Work Type:  Full Time  Required Certifications/Licensure:       PeaceHealth is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified job applicants and employees without regard to the following statuses: protected veteran; qualified individual with a disability; race; ethnicity; religion; gender; pregnancy; gender identity; national origin; age; genetic information; sexual orientation; or any other protected status in accordance with local, state, or federal laws.       The above information is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by this position. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of caregivers assigned to this job.       Posting Notes: Vancouver || Business, Administrative & Facilities || Accounting & Finance || Full Time || FINANCE SVCS

Description What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team membersthey embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western valuesstraightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.   Job Description Summary  Responsible for contributing to unit's growth and profitability by providing marketing, portfolio management and credit support for senior relationship managers and relationship managers. May manage a portfolio of less complex relationships. Generally targets companies with sales of less than $50 million   Essential Job Functions  Provides historical financial analysis for CRs and other purposes.  Maintains credit compliance including monitoring documentation and providing regular financial analysis. Identifies potential problem loans.  Prepares CRs.  Prepares all internal documentation required.  Prepares financial models including obtaining and analyzing all necessary financial data using specialized commercial credit analysis software.  Researches market for prospective clients. May prepare business development plan. Makes joint calls on customers and prospects.  Prepares marketing materials and participates in presentation.  May manage a portfolio of less complex commercial banking relationships providing consultative advice and products and services to meet customers needs and enhance and expand banking relationships.  Other Job Duties  Promotes good customer relations and identifies opportunities to refer customers and/or potential customers to other units of the bank to provide cross-sell opportunities that meet the Banks and customers needs.  Performs other duties as assigned.  *LI-TW1  Qualifications  Required Experience  Requires advanced knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.  May have practical knowledge of project management.  Education  Bachelor's Degree  Skills  Some experience in commercial lending.  Some knowledge of commercial lending policies, procedures, practices and documentation.  Good knowledge of accounting, financial statement and cash flow analysis, and financial model analysis and presentation.  Fundamental knowledge of financial services used by commercial customers.  Limited knowledge of capital markets.  Documentation knowledge.  Financial analysis skills.  Written and verbal communication skills. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran. Job Title: Principal Data Scientist Demand Sensing, Enterprise Data & Analytics
Description: At Nike, we serve athletes. Fueled by the insights of the world's best, we design and create products to elevate human potential on a global scale. And it's on us, the Global Operations Team (GOT), to help bring this mission to life.   We are a diverse lineup of thousands spread across the globe. Together, we are building a smarter, more connected and automated value chain. And we are looking for world-class talent like you to contribute to this journey.   Nike is looking for a Principal Data Scientist who can lead and grow teams of machine learning engineers and data scientists to deliver high quality advanced analytics solutions to customers across our business. You will work on a variety of complex business problems specifically focused on inventory optimization, demand sensing and forecasting. You will lead teams test new and interesting hypotheses, explore new methods to increase the forecast accuracy, and extract signals from new data. You will leverage big data, parallel processing technologies, advanced analytics, machine learning, and deep learning techniques to quantitatively plan product demand, allocate resources, and target the right customers with the best products. You will foster partnerships with best of breed open source communities, commercial vendors, and universities. Above all, your work will accelerate Nike's core mission of serving Athletes*.   What youll do  Collaborate with key stakeholders to explore opportunities to develop data driven solutions by developing and utilizing statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms Translate ambiguous statements into structured problem statements and testable hypotheses Analyze and profile available, reliable, and relevant data (internal and external) to uncover insights in support of scalable solutions Select and validate appropriate models to discover meaningful patterns and insights for a wide variety of business problems Define and track model accuracy, ensuring model relevance and reliability; enhance the model as needed Create clear and structured deliverables to communicate meaningful insights and prescribe actionable data driven business solution recommendations Build trust and drive business adoption by demystifying solution intricacies for stakeholders Collaborate with a team of data scientists, solutions delivery managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to take an opportunity or pain point from concept to scaled solution Create awareness of industry and technology trends as well as emerging tools & techniques relevant to the discipline, encouraging application within Nike Cultivate a continuous learning environment within the organization and advanced analytics community through persistent development of new skills and sharing of knowledge through mentorships and contributions to the open source community Define and establish best practices Influence and drive the strategy for one or more products; identify requirements, create development plans and interface with business stakeholders Lead the teams development and application of new methodologies; identify and solve for roadblocks Qualifications Who you are Thought leader Strong background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field Expert knowledge of applied data science Expert in machine learning algorithms and data science methods Expert in various programming and scripting languages Expert understanding and experience with CRISP-DM and Agile data   science framework Expert knowledge and experience with a diversity of tools and   platforms Proven experience creating new, useable algorithms Expert understanding of data structures and algorithms Expert understanding of solution and technical design Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset Able to influence and communicate effectively, both verbally and   written, with team members, business stakeholders and leadership Able to quickly pick up new programming languages, technologies, and   frameworks

Job Summary: OVERVIEW   Data Reporting Analyst Sr.   Data & Technology Solutions   Portland, OR  RESPONSIBILITIES & REQUIREMENTS  Cambia Health Solutions is working to create a seamless and frictionless health care experience for consumers nationwide. This presents a unique challenge and opportunity for innovative solutions. Are you a Data Reporting Analyst* If so, Cambia Health needs you!   Serves as a data and analytic consultant for functional business areas by collecting and analyzing operation and financial data. Presents findings on any trends and assists business leaders with forecasting in support of evidence based decision making.  Responsibilities in this role will include: Provides analytical support to any or all divisions of the organization by mining data, conducting analysis, and interpreting results related to business needs. Develops methodologies and approaches to new tasks and projects through design and development of analytical models and reports. Proactively identify issues and concerns to management. Develops knowledge of health plan operations, health plan data sources and structures, and cost containment strategies. Identifies problems or needed changes, recommends resolution, and participates in quality improvement efforts.  At Cambia, we advocate for transforming the health care system. You aren t satisfied with the status quo and neither are we. We're looking for individuals who are as passionate as we are about transforming the way people experience health care. We offer a competitive salary and a generous benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug and tobacco-free workplace. We have a century of experience in developing and providing health solutions to serve our members. XPO Logistics provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies and we’re constantly looking for superior talent to keep our operation running smoothly. As the Senior Business Analyst, you will offer expertise in problem-solving and analysis, process mapping, and reengineering to ensure that best practices are being achieved in process, technology, and organizational design. We will equip you with the best tools in the industry to grow and develop to a level that will exceed your expectations and help you reach the goals you set for yourself, your colleagues, your career, and your customers.  Pay, benefits and more.  We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.  What you’ll do on a typical day: Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders to elicit detailed business requirements using a variety of techniques to include interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process workflows, value stream mapping, prototypes, storyboards, and user case scenarios Develop work plans, completion of deliverables, definition of overall approaches, and mobilization efforts for each initiative Provide subject matter expertise to support business requirement definition, process design, implementation of processes, organizational change, and timing for impacted processes across all work teams Evaluate business requirements, decompose high-level information into functional requirements, validate that requirements are based on business needs rather than user preferences, reconcile conflicts, and then document the functional requirements Collaborate with counterparts in Information Technology to define and implement solutions and troubleshoot production issues What you need to succeed at XPO:  At a minimum, you’ll need:  Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related field 4 years of applicable work experience Experience in operation support for Accounting and Financial Shared Service departments Hands-on experience in implementing or supporting one or more of the following Oracle applications in vR12: General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Fixed Assets, Oracle Business Intelligence – Financial Analytics, Hyperion Experience in Oracle system administration functions, Oracle BI/XML Publisher  It’d be great if you also have:  Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to translate business needs into actionable application and operations requirements Ability to work with a diverse group of work partners Be part of something big.  XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. (Obtain the contact information to print or add to your jobs.)   Having difficulty using this button?  Job Summary: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Nike's relentless pursuit of product innovation and sustainable growth demands bold new ways of doing business - including supplier engagement. Stretching far beyond conventional sourcing, Nike Procurement secures the best supplier relationships to drive business success. The team maximizes the value and reach of the company's investments in external resources, including product materials, marketing services, digital tools, temporary labor, high-tech manufacturing equipment and other products and services to fuel business growth and sustainability. **Description** Nike Global Procurement is on a mission to maximize consumer value, partner to win across the organization and create the future of how Nike thinks about data. Spend Analytics is part of our broader analytics initiative to provide meaningful insights across all of Procurement. We are looking for someone with a passion for data and analytics and an unwavering curiosity to learn, dig, and uncover interesting insights to fuel our decision making as an organization. You will be responsible for developing robust visibility to spend and supplier information to fuel better and more meaningful procurement decisions. You will support teams across industries, but focused first on Supply Chain analyses - including analyzing fuel market trends, rates, lanes, warehousing costs, historical data, and forecasting the impact of Nike's supply chain procurement functions (inbound and outbound transportation as well as 3PL activities and facilities). You will learn and inform our strategy around the NIKE supply chain and improve the analytics around spend in both supply chain and across the Nike business. You will partner with Nike's supply chain procurement functions to research, develop, and vet data models and optimization systems, processes and tools to enable best practice RFP processes and results. Keys to success are the ability to: work as a selfless collaborator on a small team, partner with multiple stakeholders, use systems thinking to frame-up and solve problems, and communicate complex ideas in simple ways. Comfort with data and the ability to distill complex information into relevant actionable insights is a requirement. Experience with complex data and analytical models are a must. Excel skills and Tableau are a must, Alteryx experience is highly desired. We are a close knit team, and are looking to expand our talent bench through this critically important role. If you love to learn, want a lot of ownership over your work, feel that nothing is impossible and can't help but to ask 'why' - then this job is for you. Accountabilities + Own, execute, and drive Supply Chain Analytics scope for Global Procurement team + Manage update and maintenance of RFP Analytics partnering with Procurement Analysts + Bring creative solutions to ways to structure, visualize, and think about complex problems + Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather analytics inputs and ensure business alignment + Partner with Market Intel manager to understand relevant macro and micro market trends and forecasting methodologies + Collaborate with partners to translate goals and objectives into projects and timelines with associated deliverables + Present technical data effectively in both oral and written formats to a wide variety of users + Proactively manage multiple projects through business prioritization and active communicatio  Job Classification: Operations Research Analysts  Access our   statewide   or   regional   occupation report for more information about wages,   employment outlooks, skills, training programs, related occupations, and more. Job Title: Senior Software Engineer Location: Portland, OR (Downtown)  ?  About this Role: ?  The comScore Branded Entertainment team is looking for a Sr. Full Stack Engineer experienced in all layers of software development. The Senior Software Engineer will work with cross-functional teams to develop and enhance web and desktop applications for internal and external users. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.   ?  What You'll Do: Participate in requirements gathering, design, development and enhancement of new systems to be incorporated within the existing processing environment. Design and build scalable, high-availability applications, web services and portals. Manage multiple assignments and balance workload according to priorities. Collaborate and mentor cross-functional team members to identify and implement project solutions. What You'll Need: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field as well as 5+ years in a software engineering role. Full stack .NET development experience in C# applications with WinForms, MVC, and advanced knowledge of Microsoft SQL server. Advanced knowledge of RESTful architecture, SOAP, and WCF. Experience in the design and development of web-based APIs using JSON. Experience in JavaScript, HTML, CSS and other front-end technologies/patterns preferred. Solid understanding of algorithms, design patterns, data structures, and object-oriented design. Experience in the design and development of data-driven solutions. Drive to search, identify, and advocate for better practices and solutions for the team and the company. A passion and excitement for developing software. A passion for continual improvement of self, team, and the company. Energized by tackling complex problems autonomously and in a team environment. Ownership of the architecture and design of software solutions. Mentor and coach developers across teams. Active in the software engineering community Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills Capable of working on multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to work effectively with management, customers, business analysts and other developers. About comScore:  At comScore, we’re pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients & partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we’re united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you’re motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we’d love to hear from you.   ?   comScore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, comScore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, comScore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement.
